00123 #define NB_OPT_TOK 10
00124 #define NB_TOK_PATH 20

00145 uint64_t nfs4_PseudoToId( nfs_fh4 * fh4p )
00146 {
00147   file_handle_v4_t * pfhandle4;
00148   uint64_t out = 0LL ;
00149   
00150   pfhandle4 = (file_handle_v4_t *)(fh4p->nfs_fh4_val) ;
00151 
00152   out = (uint64_t) (pfhandle4->pseudofs_id)  ;
00153   return out ;
00154 } /* nfs4_PseudoToId */

00170 
00180 int nfs4_ExportToPseudoFS( exportlist_t * pexportlist )
00181 {
00182         exportlist_t      * entry ;
00183   exportlist_t      * next;     /* exportlist entry   */
00184         int                 i = 0 ;
00185   int                 j = 0 ;
00186   int                 found = 0 ;
00187   char                tmp_pseudopath[MAXPATHLEN] ;
00188   char              * PathTok[NB_TOK_PATH] ;
00189   int                 NbTokPath ;
00190   pseudofs_t        * PseudoFs = NULL ;
00191   pseudofs_entry_t  * PseudoFsRoot = NULL ;
00192   pseudofs_entry_t  * PseudoFsCurrent = NULL ;
00193   pseudofs_entry_t  * newPseudoFsEntry = NULL ;
00194   pseudofs_entry_t  * iterPseudoFs = NULL ;
00195 
00196         entry = pexportlist ;
00197   
00198   PseudoFs = &gPseudoFs ;
00199   
00200   
00201   /* Init Root of the Pseudo FS tree */
00202   strncpy( PseudoFs->root.name, "/", MAXNAMLEN ) ;
00203   strncpy( PseudoFs->root.fullname, "(nfsv4root)", MAXPATHLEN ) ;
00204   PseudoFs->root.pseudo_id = 0 ;
00205   PseudoFs->root.junction_export = NULL ;
00206   PseudoFs->root.next = NULL ;
00207   PseudoFs->root.last = PseudoFsRoot ;
00208   PseudoFs->root.sons = NULL ;
00209   PseudoFs->root.parent = &(PseudoFs->root) ; /* root is its own parent */
00210   
00211   /* Allocation of the parsing table */
00212   for( i = 0 ; i < NB_TOK_PATH ; i++ )
00213     if( (PathTok[i] = (char *)Mem_Alloc(MAXNAMLEN)) == NULL )
00214       return ENOMEM ;
00215   
00216         while (entry)
00217     {
00218       /* To not forget to init "/" entry */
00219       PseudoFsCurrent = &(PseudoFs->root) ;
00220       PseudoFs->reverse_tab[0] = &(PseudoFs->root) ;
00221       
00222       if( entry->options & EXPORT_OPTION_PSEUDO )
00223         {
00224           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Id          = %d", entry->id);
00225           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: ANON        = %d", entry->anonymous_uid);
00226           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Path        = %s", entry->fullpath);
00227           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Options     = 0x%x", entry->options);
00228           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Num Clients = %d", entry->clients.num_clients);
00229           
00230           /* A pseudo path is to ne managed */
00231           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Now managing %s seen as %s",
00232                            entry->fullpath, entry->pseudopath ) ;
00233           
00234           /* Parsing the path */
00235           strncpy( tmp_pseudopath, entry->pseudopath, MAXPATHLEN ) ;
00236           if( ( NbTokPath = nfs_ParseConfLine( PathTok, NB_TOK_PATH, tmp_pseudopath, find_slash, find_endLine ) ) < 0 )
00237             {
00238               /* Path is badly formed */
00239               DisplayLog( "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Invalid 'pseudo' option: %s", entry->pseudopath ) ;
00240               continue ;
00241             }
00242           
00243           /* there must be a leading '/' in the pseudo path */
00244           if( entry->pseudopath[0] != '/' )
00245             {
00246               /* Path is badly formed */
00247               DisplayLog( "Pseudo Path '%s' is badly formed", entry->pseudopath ) ;
00248               continue ;
00249             }
00250           
00251           /* Loop on each token. Because first character in pseudo path is '/'
00252            * we can avoid looking at PathTok[0] which is necessary '\0'. That's 
00253            * the reason why we start looping at pos = 1 */
00254 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00255           for( j = 1 ; j < NbTokPath ; j++ )
00256             printf( "     tokens are #%s#\n", PathTok[j] ) ;
00257 #endif
00258 
00259           for( j = 1 ; j < NbTokPath ; j++ )
00260             {
00261               found = 0 ;
00262               for( iterPseudoFs = PseudoFsCurrent->sons ; iterPseudoFs !=  NULL ; iterPseudoFs = iterPseudoFs->next )
00263                 {
00264                   /* Looking for a matching entry */
00265                   if( !strcmp( iterPseudoFs->name, PathTok[j] ) )
00266                     {
00267                       found = 1 ;
00268                       break ;
00269                     }
00270                 } /* for iterPseudoFs */
00271               
00272               if( found )
00273                 {
00274                   /* a matching entry was found in the tree */
00275                   PseudoFsCurrent = iterPseudoFs ;
00276                 }
00277               else
00278                 {
00279                   /* a new entry is to be created */
00280                   if( ( newPseudoFsEntry = (pseudofs_entry_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof( pseudofs_entry_t ) ) ) == NULL )
00281                     return ENOMEM ;
00282                   
00283                   /* Creating the new entry, allocate an id for it and add it to reverse tab */
00284                   strncpy( newPseudoFsEntry->name, PathTok[j], MAXNAMLEN ) ;
00285                   newPseudoFsEntry->pseudo_id = PseudoFs->last_pseudo_id + 1 ;
00286                   PseudoFs->last_pseudo_id = newPseudoFsEntry->pseudo_id ;
00287                   PseudoFs->reverse_tab[PseudoFs->last_pseudo_id] = newPseudoFsEntry ;
00288                   newPseudoFsEntry->junction_export = NULL ;
00289                   newPseudoFsEntry->last   = newPseudoFsEntry;
00290                   newPseudoFsEntry->next   = NULL ;
00291                   newPseudoFsEntry->sons   = NULL ;
00292                   snprintf( newPseudoFsEntry->fullname, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/%s", PseudoFsCurrent->fullname,  PathTok[j] ) ;
00293 
00294                   /* Step into the new entry and attach it to the tree */
00295                   if( PseudoFsCurrent->sons == NULL )
00296                     PseudoFsCurrent->sons = newPseudoFsEntry ;
00297                   else
00298                     {
00299                       PseudoFsCurrent->sons->last->next = newPseudoFsEntry ;
00300                       PseudoFsCurrent->sons->last = newPseudoFsEntry ;
00301                     }
00302                   newPseudoFsEntry->parent = PseudoFsCurrent ;
00303                   PseudoFsCurrent = newPseudoFsEntry ;
00304                 }
00305               
00306             } /* for j */
00307 
00308           /* Now that all entries are added to pseudofs tree, add the junction to the pseudofs */
00309           PseudoFsCurrent->junction_export = entry ;
00310           
00311         } /* if( entry->options & EXPORT_OPTION_PSEUDO ) */
00312       
00313       next = entry->next;
00314       
00315       entry = next;
00316     } /* while( entry ) */
00317   
00318   
00319   /* desalocation of the parsing table */
00320   for( i = 0 ; i < NB_TOK_PATH ; i++ )
00321     Mem_Free(PathTok[i] ) ;
00322   
00323         return (0);
00324 }
00325 
00341 int nfs4_PseudoToFattr( pseudofs_entry_t * psfsp, 
00342                         fattr4           * Fattr ,
00343                         compound_data_t  * data,
00344                         nfs_fh4          * objFH,
00345                         bitmap4          * Bitmap)
00346 {
00347   fattr4_type               file_type ;
00348   fattr4_link_support       link_support ;
00349   fattr4_symlink_support    symlink_support ;
00350   fattr4_fh_expire_type     expire_type ;
00351   fattr4_named_attr         named_attr ;
00352   fattr4_unique_handles     unique_handles ;
00353   fattr4_archive            archive ;
00354   fattr4_cansettime         cansettime ;
00355   fattr4_case_insensitive   case_insensitive ;
00356   fattr4_case_preserving    case_preserving ;
00357   fattr4_chown_restricted   chown_restricted ;
00358   fattr4_hidden             hidden ;
00359   fattr4_mode               file_mode ;
00360   fattr4_no_trunc           no_trunc ;
00361   fattr4_numlinks           file_numlinks ;
00362   fattr4_rawdev             rawdev ;
00363   fattr4_system             system ;
00364   fattr4_size               file_size ;
00365   fattr4_space_used         file_space_used ;
00366   fattr4_fsid               fsid ;
00367   fattr4_time_access        time_access ;
00368   fattr4_time_modify        time_modify ;
00369   fattr4_time_metadata      time_metadata ;
00370   fattr4_time_delta         time_delta ;
00371   fattr4_time_backup        time_backup ;
00372   fattr4_time_create        time_create ;
00373   fattr4_change             file_change ;
00374   fattr4_fileid             file_id ;
00375   fattr4_owner              file_owner ;
00376   fattr4_owner_group        file_owner_group ;
00377   fattr4_space_avail        space_avail ;
00378   fattr4_space_free         space_free ;
00379   fattr4_space_total        space_total ;
00380   fattr4_files_avail        files_avail ;
00381   fattr4_files_free         files_free ;
00382   fattr4_files_total        files_total ;
00383   fattr4_lease_time         lease_time ;
00384   fattr4_maxfilesize        max_filesize ;
00385   fattr4_supported_attrs    supported_attrs ;
00386   fattr4_maxread            maxread ;
00387   fattr4_maxwrite           maxwrite ;
00388   fattr4_maxname            maxname ;
00389   fattr4_maxlink            maxlink ;
00390   fattr4_homogeneous        homogeneous ;
00391   fattr4_acl                acl ;
00392   fattr4_mimetype           mimetype ;
00393   fattr4_aclsupport         aclsupport ;
00394   fattr4_fs_locations       fs_locations ;
00395   fattr4_quota_avail_hard   quota_avail_hard ;
00396   fattr4_quota_avail_soft   quota_avail_soft ;
00397   fattr4_quota_used         quota_used ;
00398   fattr4_mounted_on_fileid  mounted_on_fileid ;
00399 
00400   u_int        fhandle_len = 0 ;
00401   uint32_t     supported_attrs_len = 0 ;
00402   uint32_t     supported_attrs_val = 0 ;
00403   unsigned int LastOffset ;
00404   unsigned int len = 0 , off = 0 ; /* Use for XDR alignment */
00405   int          op_attr_success = 0 ;
00406   unsigned int c           = 0 ;
00407   unsigned int status      = 0 ;
00408   unsigned int i           = 0 ;
00409   unsigned int j           = 0 ;
00410   unsigned int k           = 0 ;
00411   unsigned int attrmasklen = 0 ;
00412   unsigned int attribute_to_set = 0 ; 
00413 
00414   unsigned int attrvalslist_supported[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ;
00415   unsigned int attrmasklist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */ 
00416   unsigned int attrvalslist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
00417   char     attrvalsBuffer[ ATTRVALS_BUFFLEN] ;
00418  
00419   char     funcname[] = "nfs4_PseudoToFattr" ;
00420   
00421 
00422   /* memset to make sure the arrays are initiated to 0 */
00423   memset( attrvalsBuffer, 0, NFS4_ATTRVALS_BUFFLEN ) ;
00424   memset( &attrmasklist, 0, FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID * sizeof( unsigned int ) ) ;
00425   memset( &attrvalslist, 0, FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID * sizeof( unsigned int ) ) ;
00426 
00427   /* Convert the attribute bitmap to an attribute list */
00428   nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( Bitmap, &attrmasklen, attrmasklist ) ;
00429   
00430   /* Once the bitmap has been converted to a list of attribute, manage each attribute */
00431   Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len = 0 ;
00432   LastOffset  = 0 ; 
00433   j=0 ;
00434 
00435 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00436   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00437                    "Asked Attributes (Pseudo): Bitmap = (len=%d, val[0]=%d, val[1]=%d), %d item in list", 
00438                    Bitmap->bitmap4_len, Bitmap->bitmap4_val[0], Bitmap->bitmap4_val[1],  attrmasklen ) ;
00439 #endif
00440 
00441  
00442  for( i = 0 ; i < attrmasklen ; i++ )
00443     {
00444       attribute_to_set = attrmasklist[i] ;
00445       
00446       DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
00447                         NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Flag for Operation (Pseudo) = %d|%d is ON,  name  = %s  reply_size = %d", 
00448                        attrmasklist[i], 
00449                        fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].val, 
00450                        fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].name, 
00451                        fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
00452 
00453       op_attr_success = 0 ;
00454       
00455       /* compute the new size for the fattr4 reply */
00456       /* This space is to be filled below in the big switch/case statement */
00457 
00458       switch( attribute_to_set )
00459         {
00460         case FATTR4_SUPPORTED_ATTRS:
00461 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00462           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SUPPORTED_ATTRS\n" ) ;
00463 #endif            
00464           /* The supported attributes have field ',supported' set in tab fattr4tab, I will proceed in 2 pass 
00465            * 1st: compute the number of supported attributes
00466            * 2nd: allocate the replyed bitmap and fill it
00467            *
00468            * I do not set a #define to keep the number of supported attributes because I want this parameter
00469            * to be a consequence of fattr4tab and avoid incoherency */
00470           
00471           /* How many supported attributes ? Compute the result in variable named c and set attrvalslist_supported  */
00472           c = 0 ;
00473           for( k = FATTR4_SUPPORTED_ATTRS ; k <= FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID ; k++ )
00474             {
00475               if( fattr4tab[k].supported )
00476                 {
00477                   attrvalslist_supported[c++] = k ;
00478                 }
00479             }
00480           
00481           /* Let set the reply bitmap */
00483           if( ( supported_attrs.bitmap4_val = (uint32_t *)Mem_Alloc( 2*sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ) == NULL )
00484             return -1 ; 
00485           memset( supported_attrs.bitmap4_val, 0, 2*sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
00486           nfs4_list_to_bitmap4( &supported_attrs, &c, attrvalslist_supported ) ;
00487 
00488 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO          
00489           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Fattr (pseudo) supported_attrs(len)=%u -> %u|%u", 
00490                            supported_attrs.bitmap4_len, supported_attrs.bitmap4_val[0],
00491                            supported_attrs.bitmap4_val[1] ) ;
00492 #endif
00493           
00494 
00495           /* This kind of operation is always a success */
00496           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00497 
00498           /* we store the index */
00499           supported_attrs_len = htonl( supported_attrs.bitmap4_len ) ;
00500           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &supported_attrs_len, sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ; 
00501           LastOffset += sizeof( uint32_t ) ;   
00502 
00503           /* And then the data */
00504           for( k = 0 ; k <  supported_attrs.bitmap4_len ; k++ )
00505             {
00506               supported_attrs_val = htonl( supported_attrs.bitmap4_val[k] ) ;
00507               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &supported_attrs_val, sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
00508               LastOffset += sizeof( uint32_t ) ;
00509             }
00510           break ;
00511               
00512         case FATTR4_TYPE:
00513 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00514           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TYPE\n" ) ;
00515 #endif
00516           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00517           file_type = htonl( NF4DIR ) ; /* There are only directories in the pseudo fs */
00518 
00519           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_type, sizeof( fattr4_type ) ) ;
00520           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00521           break ;
00522               
00523         case FATTR4_FH_EXPIRE_TYPE:
00524 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00525           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FH_EXPIRE_TYPE\n" ) ;
00526 #endif
00527           /* For the moment, we handle only the persistent filehandle */
00528           expire_type = htonl( FH4_VOLATILE_ANY ) ;
00529           /* expire_type = htonl( FH4_PERSISTENT ) ; */
00530           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &expire_type, sizeof( expire_type ) ) ;
00531           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00532           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00533           break ;
00534               
00535         case FATTR4_CHANGE:
00536 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00537           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_CHANGE\n" ) ;
00538 #endif
00539           /* Use boot time as time value for every pseudo fs object */
00540           memset( &file_change, 0, sizeof( changeid4 ) ) ;
00541           file_change = nfs_htonl64(  (changeid4)ServerBootTime ) ;
00542 
00543           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_change, sizeof(  fattr4_change ) ) ;
00544           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00545           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00546           break ;
00547               
00548         case FATTR4_SIZE:
00549 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00550           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SIZE\n" ) ;
00551 #endif
00552           file_size = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_size)DEV_BSIZE );       
00553           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_size, sizeof(  fattr4_size ) ) ;
00554           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00555           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00556           break ;
00557               
00558         case FATTR4_LINK_SUPPORT:
00559 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00560           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_LINK_SUPPORT\n" ) ;
00561 #endif
00562           /* HPSS NameSpace support hard link */
00563           link_support = htonl( TRUE );
00564           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &link_support, sizeof( fattr4_link_support )) ; 
00565           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00566           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00567           break ;
00568               
00569         case FATTR4_SYMLINK_SUPPORT:
00570 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00571           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SYMLINK_SUPPORT\n" ) ;
00572 #endif
00573           /* HPSS NameSpace support symbolic link */
00574           symlink_support = htonl( TRUE ) ;
00575           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &symlink_support, sizeof( fattr4_symlink_support )) ; 
00576           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00577           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00578           break ;
00579               
00580         case FATTR4_NAMED_ATTR:
00581 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00582           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_NAMED_ATTR\n" ) ;
00583 #endif
00584           /* For this version of the binary, named attributes is not supported */
00585           named_attr = htonl( FALSE ) ;
00586           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &named_attr, sizeof( fattr4_named_attr )) ;
00587           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00588           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00589           break ;
00590               
00591         case FATTR4_FSID:
00592 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00593           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FSID\n" ) ;
00594 #endif
00595           /* The file system id (should be unique per fileset according to the HPSS logic) */
00596           if( psfsp->junction_export == NULL )
00597             {
00598               fsid.major = nfs_htonl64( 152LL ) ;
00599               fsid.minor = nfs_htonl64( 152LL ) ;
00600             }
00601           else
00602             {
00603               fsid.major = nfs_htonl64( 153LL ) ; /* @todo BUGAZOMEU : tres cradem mais utile */
00604               fsid.minor = nfs_htonl64( 153LL ) ;
00605             }
00606           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &fsid, sizeof( fattr4_fsid) ) ;
00607           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00608           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00609           break ;
00610               
00611         case FATTR4_UNIQUE_HANDLES:
00612 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00613           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_UNIQUE_HANDLES\n" ) ;
00614 #endif
00615           /* Filehandles are unique */ 
00616           unique_handles = htonl( TRUE );
00617           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &unique_handles, sizeof( fattr4_unique_handles) ) ;
00618           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00619           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00620           break ;
00621               
00622         case FATTR4_LEASE_TIME:
00623 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00624           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_LEASE_TIME\n" ) ;
00625 #endif
00626           lease_time = htonl( NFS4_LEASE_LIFETIME ) ;
00627           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &lease_time, sizeof( fattr4_lease_time ) ) ;
00628           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00629           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00630           break ;
00631               
00632         case FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR:
00633 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00634           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR\n" ) ;
00635 #endif
00636           op_attr_success = htonl( 0 ) ; /* not used in a getattr call */
00637           break ;
00638               
00639         case FATTR4_ACL:
00640 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00641           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_ACL\n" ) ;
00642 #endif
00643           acl.fattr4_acl_len = htonl( 0 ) ;
00644           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &acl, sizeof( fattr4_acl ) ) ;
00645           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00646           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00647           break ;
00648               
00649         case FATTR4_ACLSUPPORT:
00650 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00651           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_ACL_SUPPORT\n" ) ;
00652 #endif
00653           aclsupport = htonl( ACL4_SUPPORT_DENY_ACL ) ; /* temporary, wanting for houston to give me information to implemente ACL's support */
00654           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &aclsupport, sizeof( fattr4_aclsupport ) ) ;
00655           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00656           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00657           break ;
00658               
00659         case FATTR4_ARCHIVE:
00660 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00661           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_ARCHIVE\n" ) ;
00662 #endif
00663           /* Archive flag is not supported */
00664           archive = htonl( FALSE ) ;
00665           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &archive,sizeof( fattr4_archive ) ); 
00666           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00667           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00668           break ;
00669               
00670         case FATTR4_CANSETTIME:
00671 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00672           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_CANSETTIME\n" ) ;
00673 #endif
00674           /* The time can be set on files */
00675           cansettime = htonl( TRUE );
00676           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &cansettime, sizeof( fattr4_cansettime ) ) ;
00677           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00678           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00679           break ;
00680               
00681         case FATTR4_CASE_INSENSITIVE:
00682 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00683           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_CASE_INSENSITIVE\n" ) ;
00684 #endif
00685           /* pseudofs is not case INSENSITIVE... it is Read-Only */
00686           case_insensitive = htonl( FALSE );
00687           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &case_insensitive, sizeof( fattr4_case_insensitive ) ) ;
00688           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00689           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00690           break ;
00691               
00692         case FATTR4_CASE_PRESERVING:
00693 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00694           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_PRESERVING\n" ) ;
00695 #endif
00696           /* pseudofs is case preserving... it is Read-Only */
00697           case_preserving = htonl( TRUE ) ;
00698           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &case_preserving, sizeof( fattr4_case_preserving ) );
00699           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00700           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00701           break ;
00702               
00703         case FATTR4_CHOWN_RESTRICTED :
00704 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00705           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_CHOWN_RESTRICTED\n" ) ;
00706 #endif
00707           /* chown is restricted to root, but in fact no chown will be done on pseudofs */
00708           chown_restricted = htonl( TRUE ) ;
00709           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &chown_restricted, sizeof( fattr4_chown_restricted ) ) ; 
00710           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00711           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00712           break ;
00713               
00714         case FATTR4_FILEHANDLE:
00715 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00716           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FILEHANDLE\n" ) ;
00717 #endif
00718           /* Return the file handle */
00719           fhandle_len = htonl( objFH->nfs_fh4_len ) ;
00720 
00721           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  
00722                   &fhandle_len, 
00723                   sizeof( u_int ) ) ; 
00724           LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
00725 
00726           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00727                   objFH->nfs_fh4_val, 
00728                   objFH->nfs_fh4_len );
00729           LastOffset +=  objFH->nfs_fh4_len ;
00730           
00731           /* XDR's special stuff for 32-bit alignment */
00732           len = objFH->nfs_fh4_len ;
00733           off = 0 ;
00734           while( ( len + off ) %4 != 0 )
00735             {
00736               char c = '\0' ;
00737               
00738               off += 1 ;
00739               memset( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), c, 1 );
00740               LastOffset += 1 ;
00741             }
00742           
00743           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00744           break ;
00745               
00746         case FATTR4_FILEID:
00747 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00748           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FILEID\n" ) ;
00749 #endif
00750           /* The analog to the inode number. RFC3530 says "a number uniquely identifying the file within the filesystem" 
00751            * In the case of a pseudofs entry, the entry's unique id is used */
00752           file_id =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_fileid)psfsp->pseudo_id ) ;
00753           
00754           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &file_id, sizeof( fattr4_fileid ) ) ; 
00755           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00756           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00757           break ;
00758               
00759         case FATTR4_FILES_AVAIL :
00760 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00761           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FILES_AVAIL\n" ) ;
00762 #endif
00763           files_avail =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_files_avail)512 ); /* Fake value */
00764           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &files_avail, sizeof( fattr4_files_avail ) ) ;
00765           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00766           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00767           break ;
00768               
00769         case FATTR4_FILES_FREE  :
00770 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00771           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FILES_FREE\n" ) ;
00772 #endif
00773           files_free = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_files_avail)512 ) ;  /* Fake value */
00774           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &files_free, sizeof( fattr4_files_free ) ) ;
00775           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00776           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00777           break ;
00778               
00779         case FATTR4_FILES_TOTAL :

00785           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00786           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00787           break ;
00788           
00789

00793 #endif
00794           fs_locations.fs_root.pathname4_len = 0 ;
00795           fs_locations.locations.locations_len = 0 ; /* No FS_LOCATIONS no now */
00796           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00797           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00798           break ;
00799 
00800               
00801         case FATTR4_HIDDEN :
00802 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00803           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_HIDDEN\n" ) ;
00804 #endif
00805           /* There are no hidden file in pseudofs */
00806           hidden = htonl( FALSE );
00807           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &hidden, sizeof( fattr4_hidden ) );
00808           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00809           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00810           break ;
00811               
00812         case FATTR4_HOMOGENEOUS:
00813 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00814           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_HOMOGENEOUS\n" ) ;
00815 #endif
00816           /* Unix semantic is homogeneous (all objects have the same kind of attributes) */
00817           homogeneous = htonl( TRUE ) ;
00818           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &homogeneous, sizeof( fattr4_homogeneous ) );
00819           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00820           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00821           break ;
00822               
00823         case FATTR4_MAXFILESIZE :
00824 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO

00826 #endif
00827           max_filesize = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_maxfilesize)FSINFO_MAX_FILESIZE );
00828           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &max_filesize, sizeof( fattr4_maxfilesize ) );
00829           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00830           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00831           break ;
00832

00839           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;

00841           break ;

00881           break ;
00882 
00883         case FATTR4_MODE :
00884 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00885           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_MODE\n" ) ;
00886 #endif
00887           file_mode = htonl( 0555 ); /* Every pseudo fs object is dr-xr-xr-x */ 
00888           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &file_mode, sizeof( fattr4_mode )) ;              
00889           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00890           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00891           break ;
00892               
00893         case  FATTR4_NO_TRUNC:
00894 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00895           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_NO_TRUNC\n" ) ;
00896 #endif
00897           /* File's names are not truncated, an error is returned is name is too long */
00898           no_trunc = htonl( TRUE );
00899           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &no_trunc, sizeof( fattr4_no_trunc ) ) ;
00900           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00901           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00902           break ;
00903               
00904         case  FATTR4_NUMLINKS:
00905 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00906           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_NUMLINKS\n" ) ;
00907 #endif
00908           /* Reply the number of links found in vattr structure */
00909           file_numlinks = htonl( (fattr4_numlinks)1 );
00910           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_numlinks, sizeof( fattr4_numlinks ) ) ;
00911           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00912           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00913           break ;
00914               
00915         case  FATTR4_OWNER:
00916 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00917           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_OWNER\n" ) ;
00918 #endif
00919           /* Return the uid as a human readable utf8 string */
00920           if( uid2utf8( NFS4_ROOT_UID, &file_owner ) == 0 )
00921             {
00922              u_int utf8len = htonl( file_owner.utf8string_len) ;
00923 
00924               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00925                       &utf8len, 
00926                       sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
00927               LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
00928                   
00929               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00930                       file_owner.utf8string_val, 
00931                       file_owner.utf8string_len ) ;
00932               LastOffset += file_owner.utf8string_len ;
00933 
00934               op_attr_success = 1 ;
00935             }
00936           else
00937             op_attr_success = 0 ;
00938           break ;
00939               
00940         case  FATTR4_OWNER_GROUP :
00941 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00942           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_OWNER_GROUP\n" ) ;
00943 #endif
00944           /* Return the uid as a human readable utf8 string */
00945           if( gid2utf8( 2, &file_owner_group ) == 0 )
00946             {
00947              u_int utf8len = htonl( file_owner_group.utf8string_len) ;
00948 
00949               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00950                       &utf8len, 
00951                       sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
00952               LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
00953                   
00954               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00955                       file_owner_group.utf8string_val, 
00956                       file_owner_group.utf8string_len ) ;
00957               LastOffset += file_owner_group.utf8string_len ;
00958 
00959               op_attr_success = 1 ;
00960             }
00961           else
00962             op_attr_success = 0 ;
00963           break ;
00964 
00965         case  FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_HARD:
00966 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00967           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_HARD\n" ) ;
00968 #endif
00969           quota_avail_hard =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_quota_avail_hard)NFS_V4_MAX_QUOTA_HARD ) ; 
00970           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &quota_avail_hard, sizeof( fattr4_quota_avail_hard ) );
00971           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00972           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00973           break ;
00974 
00975         case FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_SOFT :
00976 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00977           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_SOFT\n" ) ;
00978 #endif
00979           quota_avail_soft =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_quota_avail_soft)NFS_V4_MAX_QUOTA_SOFT ) ; 
00980           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &quota_avail_soft, sizeof( fattr4_quota_avail_soft ) );
00981           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00982           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00983           break ;
00984 
00985         case  FATTR4_QUOTA_USED:
00986 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00987           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_USED\n" ) ;
00988 #endif
00989           quota_used =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_quota_used)NFS_V4_MAX_QUOTA ) ;
00990           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &quota_used, sizeof( fattr4_quota_used ) );
00991           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00992           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00993           break ;
00994               
00995         case  FATTR4_RAWDEV:
00996 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00997           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_RAWDEV\n" ) ;
00998 #endif
00999           /* Not usefull, there are no special block or character file in HPSS */
01000           /* since FATTR4_TYPE will never be NFS4BLK or NFS4CHR, this value should not be used by the client */
01001           rawdev.specdata1 = htonl( 0 );
01002           rawdev.specdata2 = htonl( 0 );
01003           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &rawdev, sizeof( fattr4_rawdev ) ) ;

01006           break ;
01007           
01008         case FATTR4_SPACE_AVAIL :

01016           break ;
01017           
01018         case FATTR4_SPACE_FREE :
01019 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO

01023           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &space_free, sizeof( fattr4_space_free ) ) ;
01024           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;

01034           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01035           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01036           break ;
01037               
01038         case FATTR4_SPACE_USED:
01039 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01040           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SPACE_USED\n" ) ;
01041 #endif
01042           /* the number of bytes on the filesystem used by the object, which is slightly different 
01043            * from the file's size (there can be hole in the file) */
01044           file_space_used = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_space_used)DEV_BSIZE ) ;
01045           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_space_used, sizeof( fattr4_space_used ) ) ;
01046           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01047           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01048           break ;
01049               
01050         case FATTR4_SYSTEM:
01051 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01052           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SYSTEM\n" ) ;
01053 #endif
01054           /* This is not a windows system File-System with respect to the regarding API */
01055           system = htonl( FALSE );
01056           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &system, sizeof( fattr4_system ) ) ;
01057           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01058           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01059           break ;
01060               
01061         case FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS:
01062 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01063           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS\n" ) ;
01064 #endif
01065           /* This will contain the object's time os last access, the 'atime' in the Unix semantic */
01066           memset( &(time_access.seconds), 0, sizeof( int64_t ) ) ;
01067           time_access.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)ServerBootTime );
01068           time_access.nseconds = htonl( 0 );
01069           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_access, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01070           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01071           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01072           break ;
01073           
01074         case FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS_SET:
01075 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01076           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS_SET\n" ) ;
01077 #endif
01078           /* To be used with NFS4_OP_SETATTR only */
01079           op_attr_success = 0 ;
01080           break ;
01081          
01082       case FATTR4_TIME_BACKUP :
01083 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01084           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_BACKUP\n" ) ;
01085 #endif
01086           /* No time backup, return unix's beginning of time */
01087           time_backup.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( 0LL ) ;
01088           time_backup.nseconds = htonl( 0 ) ;
01089           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_backup, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01090           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01091           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01092           break ;
01093 
01094         case FATTR4_TIME_CREATE :
01095 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01096           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_CREATE\n" ) ;
01097 #endif
01098           /* No time create, return unix's beginning of time */
01099           time_create.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( 0LL ) ;
01100           time_create.nseconds = htonl( 0 ) ;
01101           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_create, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01102           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01103           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01104           break ;
01105           
01106         case  FATTR4_TIME_DELTA:
01107 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01108           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_DELTA\n" ) ;
01109 #endif
01110 
01111           /* According to RFC3530, this is "the smallest usefull server time granularity", I set this to 1s */
01112           time_delta.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( 1LL );
01113           time_delta.nseconds = 0 ;
01114           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_delta, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01115           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01116           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01117           break ;
01118           
01119         case FATTR4_TIME_METADATA :
01120 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01121           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_METADATA\n" ) ;
01122 #endif
01123 
01124           /* The time for the last metadata operation, the ctime in the unix's semantic */
01125           memset( &(time_metadata.seconds), 0, sizeof( int64_t ) ) ;
01126           time_metadata.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)ServerBootTime );
01127           time_metadata.nseconds = htonl( 0 );
01128           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_metadata, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01129           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01130           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01131           break ;
01132           
01133         case FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY :
01134 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01135           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY\n" ) ;
01136 #endif
01137 
01138           /* The time for the last modify operation, the mtime in the unix's semantic */
01139           memset( &(time_modify.seconds), 0, sizeof( int64_t ) ) ;
01140           time_modify.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)ServerBootTime );
01141           time_modify.nseconds = htonl( 0 );
01142           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_modify, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01143           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01144           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01145           break ;
01146           
01147         case FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY_SET:
01148 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01149           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY_SET\n" ) ;
01150 #endif
01151 
01152           op_attr_success = 0 ; /* should never be used here, only for setattr */
01153           break ;
01154           
01155         case FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID :
01156 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01157           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID\n" ) ;
01158 #endif
01159 
01160           mounted_on_fileid = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_fileid)psfsp->pseudo_id );
01161           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &mounted_on_fileid, sizeof( fattr4_mounted_on_fileid ) ) ; 
01162           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01163           op_attr_success = 1 ; 
01164           break ;
01165           
01166         default:
01167           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, "Bad file attributes %d queried", attribute_to_set ) ;
01168           /* BUGAZOMEU : un traitement special ici */
01169           break ;
01170         } /* switch( attr_to_set ) */ 
01171       
01172       /* Increase the Offset for the next operation if this was a success*/
01173       if( op_attr_success )
01174         {
01175           /* Set the returned bitmask */
01176           attrvalslist[j] = attribute_to_set ;
01177           j += 1 ;
01178 
01179           /* Be carefull not to get out of attrvalsBuffer */
01180           if( LastOffset > NFS4_ATTRVALS_BUFFLEN )
01181             return -1 ;
01182         }
01183 
01184       
01185       
01186     } /* for i */
01187   
01188 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01189           printf( "----------------------------------------\n" ) ;
01190 #endif
01191 
01192   /* LastOffset contains the length of the attrvalsBuffer usefull data */
01193   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Fattr (pseudo) At the end LastOffset = %u, i=%d, j=%d", LastOffset, i, j ) ;
01194 
01195   /* Set the bitmap for result */
01197   if( ( Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_val = (uint32_t *)Mem_Alloc(  2*sizeof( uint32_t )  ) )  == NULL )
01198      return -1 ;
01199   memset( Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_val, 0, 2*sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
01200 
01201   nfs4_list_to_bitmap4( &(Fattr->attrmask), &j, attrvalslist ) ;  
01202 
01203   /* Set the attrlist4 */
01204   Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len = LastOffset ;
01205 
01207   if( (  Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val = Mem_Alloc( Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len ) ) == NULL )
01208     return -1 ;
01209   memset( Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val, 0, Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len ) ;
01210 
01211   memcpy( Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val, attrvalsBuffer, Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len );
01212   
01213   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
01214                    "nfs4_PseudoToFattr (end): Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len = %d", 
01215                    Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len ) ;
01216   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
01217                    "nfs4_PseudoToFattr (end):Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_len = %d  [0]=%u, [1]=%u", 
01218                    Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_len, Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_val[0], Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_val[1] ) ;
01219 
01220   return 0 ;
01221 } /* nfs4_PseudoToFattr*/
01222 
01223 
01224 
01225 
01237 int nfs4_FhandleToPseudo( nfs_fh4 * fh4p, pseudofs_t * psfstree, pseudofs_entry_t * psfsentry )
01238 {
01239   file_handle_v4_t * pfhandle4;
01240   
01241   /* Map the filehandle to the correct structure */
01242   pfhandle4 = (file_handle_v4_t *)(fh4p->nfs_fh4_val) ;
01243   
01244   /* The function must be called with a fh pointed to a pseudofs entry */
01245   if( pfhandle4->pseudofs_flag == FALSE )
01246     return FALSE ;
01247   
01248   /* Get the object pointer by using the reverse tab in the pseudofs structure */
01249   memcpy( psfsentry , psfstree->reverse_tab[ pfhandle4->pseudofs_id ], sizeof( pseudofs_entry_t ) ) ;
01250   
01251   return TRUE ;
01252 } /* nfs4_FhandleToPseudo */
01253 
01266 int nfs4_PseudoToFhandle( nfs_fh4 * fh4p, pseudofs_entry_t * psfsentry )
01267 {
01268   file_handle_v4_t  fhandle4 ;
01269   
01270   memset(  &fhandle4, 0, sizeof( fhandle4 ) ) ;
01271   
01272   fhandle4.pseudofs_flag = TRUE ;
01273   fhandle4.pseudofs_id = psfsentry->pseudo_id ;
01274   
01275   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "PSEUDO_TO_FH: Pseudo id = %d -> %d", psfsentry->pseudo_id, fhandle4.pseudofs_id ) ;
01276   
01277   memcpy( fh4p->nfs_fh4_val, &fhandle4, sizeof( fhandle4 ) ) ;
01278   fh4p->nfs_fh4_len = sizeof( file_handle_v4_t ) ;
01279   
01280   return TRUE ;
01281 } /* nfs4_PseudoToFhandle */
01282 
01283 
01284 
01297 int nfs4_CreateROOTFH4( nfs_fh4 * fh4p, compound_data_t * data )
01298 {
01299   pseudofs_entry_t   psfsentry ;
01300   int status = 0 ;
01301   int i = 0 ;
01302  
01303   psfsentry = * (data->pseudofs->reverse_tab[0]) ;
01304 
01305   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "CREATE ROOTFH (pseudo): root to pseudofs = #%s#", psfsentry.name ) ;
01306  
01307   if( ( status = nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->rootFH  ) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
01308     return status ;
01309  
01310   if( !nfs4_PseudoToFhandle( &(data->rootFH  ), &psfsentry ) )
01311     {
01312       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "CREATE ROOTFH (pseudo): Creation of root fh is impossible" ) ;
01313       return NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01314     }
01315  
01316     /* Test */
01317 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
01318   printf( "File handle = { Length = %d  Val = ", data->rootFH.nfs_fh4_len) ;
01319   for( i = 0 ; i < data->rootFH.nfs_fh4_len ; i++ )
01320     printf( "%02X", data->rootFH.nfs_fh4_val[i] );
01321   printf( " } \n" ) ;
01322 #endif
01323 
01324   return NFS4_OK ;
01325 } /* nfs4_CreateROOTFH4 */
01326 
01327 
01341 #define arg_GETATTR4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opgetattr
01342 #define res_GETATTR4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opgetattr
01343 
01344 int nfs4_op_getattr_pseudo(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
01345                              compound_data_t   * data,
01346                              struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
01347 {
01348   pseudofs_entry_t psfsentry ;
01349   char funcname[] = "nfs4_op_getattr" ;
01350   
01351   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_GETATTR ;
01352 
01353   /* Get the pseudo entry related to this fhandle */
01354   if( !nfs4_FhandleToPseudo( &(data->currentFH  ), data->pseudofs, &psfsentry ) )
01355     {
01356       res_GETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01357       return res_GETATTR4.status ;
01358     }
01359   
01360   
01361   /* All directories in pseudo fs have the same Fattr */
01362   if( nfs4_PseudoToFattr(   &psfsentry, 
01363                             &(res_GETATTR4.GETATTR4res_u.resok4.obj_attributes), 
01364                             data, 
01365                             &(data->currentFH),
01366                             &(arg_GETATTR4.attr_request) ) != 0 )
01367     res_GETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01368   else
01369     res_GETATTR4.status = NFS4_OK ;
01370 
01371 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
01372    printf( "Apres nfs4_PseudoToFattr: attrmask(bitmap4_len)=%d attrlist4_len=%d\n", 
01373            res_GETATTR4.GETATTR4res_u.resok4.obj_attributes.attrmask.bitmap4_len,
01374            res_GETATTR4.GETATTR4res_u.resok4.obj_attributes.attr_vals.attrlist4_len ) ;
01375 #endif
01376    
01377   return res_GETATTR4.status ;
01378 } /* nfs4_op_getattr */
01379 
01380 
01395 /* Shorter notation to avoid typos */
01396 #define res_ACCESS4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opaccess
01397 #define arg_ACCESS4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opaccess
01398 
01399 int nfs4_op_access_pseudo(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
01400                             compound_data_t   * data,
01401                             struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
01402 {
01403   char            funcname[] = "nfs4_op_access_pseudo" ;
01404   
01405   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_ACCESS ;
01406 
01407   /* All access types are supported */
01408   res_ACCESS4.ACCESS4res_u.resok4.supported = arg_ACCESS4.access ;
01409   
01410   /* DELETE/MODIFY/EXTEND are not supported in the pseudo fs */
01411   res_ACCESS4.ACCESS4res_u.resok4.access = arg_ACCESS4.access & ~(ACCESS4_MODIFY|ACCESS4_EXTEND|ACCESS4_DELETE) ;
01412  
01413   return NFS4_OK ;
01414 } /* nfs4_op_access_pseudo */
01415 
01429 /* Shorter notation to avoid typos */
01430 #define arg_LOOKUP4 op->nfs_argop4_u.oplookup
01431 #define res_LOOKUP4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplookup
01432 
01433 int nfs4_op_lookup_pseudo(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
01434                             compound_data_t   * data,
01435                             struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
01436 {
01437   char                     name[MAXNAMLEN] ;
01438   char                     funcname[] = "nfs4_op_lookup_pseudo" ;
01439   pseudofs_entry_t         psfsentry ;
01440   pseudofs_entry_t       * iter = NULL ;
01441   int                      found = FALSE ;
01442   int                      error = 0 ;
01443   cache_inode_status_t     cache_status = 0 ;
01444   fsal_status_t            fsal_status ;
01445   cache_inode_fsal_data_t  fsdata ;
01446   fsal_path_t              exportpath_fsal ;
01447   fsal_attrib_list_t       attr ;
01448   fsal_handle_t            fsal_handle ;
01449   int                      action = 0 ;
01450   cache_entry_t          * pentry = NULL ;
01451   fsal_mdsize_t            strsize = MNTPATHLEN + 1 ;
01452 
01453   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_LOOKUP ;
01454 
01455   /* UTF8 strings may not end with \0, but they carry their length */
01456   strncpy( name, arg_LOOKUP4.objname.utf8string_val, arg_LOOKUP4.objname.utf8string_len ) ;
01457   name[arg_LOOKUP4.objname.utf8string_len] = '\0' ;
01458 
01459   /* Get the pseudo fs entry related to the file handle */
01460   if( !nfs4_FhandleToPseudo( &(data->currentFH  ), data->pseudofs, &psfsentry ) )
01461     {
01462       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01463       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01464     }
01465   
01466   found = FALSE ;
01467   for( iter = psfsentry.sons ; iter != NULL ; iter = iter->next )
01468     {
01469       if( !strcmp( iter->name, name ) )
01470         {
01471           found = TRUE ;
01472           break ;
01473         }
01474     }
01475   
01476   if( !found )
01477     {
01478       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_NOENT ;
01479       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01480     }    
01481   
01482   /* A matching entry was found */
01483   if( iter->junction_export == NULL )
01484     {
01485       /* The entry is not a junction, we stay within the pseudo fs */
01486       if( !nfs4_PseudoToFhandle( &(data->currentFH), iter ) ) 
01487         {
01488           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01489           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01490         }
01491     }
01492   else
01493     {
01494       /* The entry is a junction */
01495       DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, 
01496                          NIV_DEBUG, "A junction in pseudo fs is traversed: name = %s, id = %d",
01497                          iter->name, iter->junction_export->id ) ;
01498       data->pexport = iter->junction_export ;
01499       strncpy( data->MntPath, iter->fullname, NFS_MAXPATHLEN ) ;
01500       
01501       
01502       /* Build credentials */
01503       if( nfs4_MakeCred( data ) != 0 )
01504         {
01505           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01506                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to get FSAL credentials for %s, id=%d",
01507                              data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01508           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_WRONGSEC ;
01509           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01510         }
01511 
01512       /* Build fsal data for creation of the first entry */
01513       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( ( fsal_status = FSAL_str2path( data->pexport->fullpath, strsize, &exportpath_fsal ) ) ) )
01514         {
01515           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01516           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01517         }
01518       
01519       /* Lookup the FSAL to build the fsal handle */
01520       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status = FSAL_lookupPath( &exportpath_fsal, 
01521                                                         data->pcontext, 
01522                                                         &fsal_handle, 
01523                                                         NULL ) ) )
01524         {
01525           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01526                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to lookup for %s, id=%d", 
01527                              data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01528           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01529                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: fsal_status = ( %d, %d )", 
01530                              fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
01531           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01532           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01533         }
01534 
01535       if( data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
01536         {
01537           if( ( error =  nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->mounted_on_FH) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
01538             {
01539               DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01540                                  NIV_MAJOR, 
01541                                  "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to allocate the 'mounted on' file handle" ) ;
01542               res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01543               return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01544             }
01545         }
01546       
01547       if( data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
01548         {
01549           if( ( error =  nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->currentFH) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
01550             {
01551               DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01552                                  NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to allocate the first file handle" ) ;
01553               res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01554               return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01555             }
01556         }
01557 
01558       /* Build the nfs4 handle */
01559       if( !nfs4_FSALToFhandle( &data->currentFH, &fsal_handle, data ) )
01560         {
01561           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01562                                 NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to build the first file handle" ) ;
01563           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01564           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01565         }
01566   
01567       /* The new fh is to be the "mounted on Filehandle" */
01568       memcpy( data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_val, data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val, sizeof( file_handle_v4_t ) ) ;
01569       data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len = data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ;
01570       
01571       /* Add the entry to the cache as a root (BUGAZOMEU: make it a junction entry when junction is available) */
01572       fsdata.handle = fsal_handle ;
01573       fsdata.cookie = 0 ;
01574       if( ( pentry = cache_inode_make_root( &fsdata, 
01575                                             data->ht, 
01576                                             ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient), 
01577                                             data->pcontext,
01578                                             &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
01579         {
01580           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, 
01581                            "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Allocate root entry in cache inode failed, for %s, id=%d", 
01582                            data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01583           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01584           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01585         }
01586 
01587       
01588       /* Get the attributes (costless: the attributes was cached when the root pentry was created */
01589       if(  cache_inode_getattr( pentry, 
01590                                 &attr, 
01591                                 data->ht,
01592                                 ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient), 
01593                                 data->pcontext,
01594                                 &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01595         {
01596           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01597                                 NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to get attributes for root pentry" );
01598           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01599           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01600         }
01601 
01602       /* Keep the pentry within the compound data */
01603       data->current_entry = pentry ;
01604       data->current_filetype = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( attr.type ) ;
01605       
01606     } /* else */
01607   
01608   
01609   res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4_OK ;
01610   return NFS4_OK ;
01611 } /* nfs4_op_lookup_pseudo */
01612 
01613 
01614 
01628 /* Shorter notation to avoid typos */
01629 #define arg_LOOKUPP4 op->nfs_argop4_u.oplookupp
01630 #define res_LOOKUPP4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplookupp
01631 
01632 
01633 int nfs4_op_lookupp_pseudo(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
01634                              compound_data_t   * data,
01635                              struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
01636 {
01637   char               funcname[] = "nfs4_op_lookup_pseudo" ;
01638   pseudofs_entry_t   psfsentry ;
01639   pseudofs_entry_t * iter = NULL ;
01640 
01641   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_LOOKUPP ;
01642 
01643     
01644   /* Get the pseudo fs entry related to the file handle */
01645   if( !nfs4_FhandleToPseudo( &(data->currentFH), data->pseudofs, &psfsentry ) )
01646     {
01647       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01648       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
01649     }
01650 
01651   /* A matching entry was found */
01652   if( !nfs4_PseudoToFhandle( &(data->currentFH), psfsentry.parent ) ) 
01653     {
01654       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01655       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
01656     }
01657 
01658   
01659   /* Copy this to the mounted on FH (if no junction is traversed */
01660   memcpy( (char *)(data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_val), 
01661           (char *)(data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val), data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ) ;
01662   data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len = data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ;
01663   
01664   /* Keep the vnode pointer within the data compound */
01665   data->current_entry = NULL ;
01666   data->current_filetype = UNASSIGNED ;
01667 
01668   res_LOOKUPP4.status  = NFS4_OK ;
01669   return NFS4_OK ;
01670 } /* nfs4_op_lookupp_pseudo */
01671 
01672 
01673 
01687 /* shorter notation to avoid typo */
01688 #define arg_READDIR4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opreaddir
01689 #define res_READDIR4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opreaddir
01690 
01691 int nfs4_op_readdir_pseudo( struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
01692                             compound_data_t   * data,
01693                             struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
01694 {
01695   unsigned long             dircount = 0 ; 
01696   unsigned long             maxcount = 0 ;
01697   unsigned long             estimated_num_entries = 0 ;
01698   unsigned long             i = 0 ;
01699   nfs_cookie4               cookie ;
01700   verifier4                 cookie_verifier;
01701   unsigned long             space_used = 0 ;
01702   pseudofs_entry_t          psfsentry ;
01703   pseudofs_entry_t *        iter = NULL ;
01704   entry4 *                  entry_nfs_array = NULL ;
01705   nfs_fh4                   entryFH ;
01706   cache_inode_fsal_data_t   fsdata ;
01707   fsal_path_t               exportpath_fsal ;
01708   fsal_attrib_list_t        attr ;
01709   fsal_handle_t             fsal_handle ;
01710   fsal_mdsize_t             strsize = MNTPATHLEN + 1 ;
01711   fsal_status_t             fsal_status ;
01712   int                       error = 0 ;
01713   cache_inode_status_t      cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS  ;
01714   cache_entry_t          *  pentry = NULL ;
01715 
01716   char                      funcname[] = "nfs4_op_readdir_pseudo" ;
01717     
01718   bitmap4   RdAttrErrorBitmap = { 1, (uint32_t *)"\0\0\0\b" } ; /* 0xB = 11 = FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR */
01719   attrlist4 RdAttrErrorVals   = { 0, NULL } ;                   /* Nothing to be seen here */
01720 
01721   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_READDIR ;
01722   res_READDIR4.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
01723 
01724   entryFH.nfs_fh4_len = 0 ;
01725   
01726   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Entering NFS4_OP_READDIR_PSEUDO" ) ;
01727 
01728   /* get the caracteristic value for readdir operation */
01729   dircount = arg_READDIR4.dircount ;
01730   maxcount = arg_READDIR4.maxcount ;
01731   cookie   = arg_READDIR4.cookie ;
01732   space_used = sizeof( entry4 ) ;
01733 
01734   /* dircount is considered meaningless by many nfsv4 client (like the CITI one). we use maxcount instead */
01735   estimated_num_entries = maxcount / sizeof( entry4 )  ;
01736   
01737   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, 
01738                         NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "PSEUDOFS READDIR: dircount=%d, maxcount=%d, cookie=%d, sizeof(entry4)=%d num_entries=%d",
01739                    dircount, maxcount, cookie, space_used, estimated_num_entries ) ;
01740   
01741   /* If maxcount is too short, return NFS4ERR_TOOSMALL */
01742   if( maxcount < sizeof( entry4 ) || estimated_num_entries == 0  )
01743     {
01744       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_TOOSMALL ;
01745       return res_READDIR4.status ;
01746     }
01747 
01748   /* Now resolve the file handle to pseudo fs */
01749   if( !nfs4_FhandleToPseudo( &(data->currentFH  ), data->pseudofs, &psfsentry ) )
01750     {
01751       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01752       return res_READDIR4.status ;
01753     }
01754   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "PSEUDOFS READDIR in #%s#", psfsentry.name ) ;
01755   
01756   /* If this a junction filehandle ? */
01757   if( psfsentry.junction_export != NULL )
01758     {
01759       /* This is a junction */
01760       DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, 
01761                          NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "PSEUDOFS READDIR : DIR #%s# id=%u is a junction\n", 
01762                          psfsentry.name, psfsentry.junction_export->id ) ;
01763 
01764       /* Step up the compound data */
01765       data->pexport = psfsentry.junction_export ;
01766       strncpy( data->MntPath, psfsentry.fullname, NFS_MAXPATHLEN ) ;
01767       
01768       /* Build the credentials */
01769       if( nfs4_MakeCred( data ) != 0 )
01770         {
01771           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01772                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to get FSAL credentials for %s, id=%d",
01773                              data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01774           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_WRONGSEC ;
01775           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01776         }
01777       /* Build fsal data for creation of the first entry */
01778       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( ( fsal_status = FSAL_str2path( data->pexport->fullpath, strsize, &exportpath_fsal ) ) ) )
01779         {
01780           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01781           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01782         }
01783       
01784       /* Lookup the FSAL to build the fsal handle */
01785       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status = FSAL_lookupPath( &exportpath_fsal, 
01786                                                         data->pcontext, 
01787                                                         &fsal_handle, 
01788                                                         NULL ) ) )
01789         {
01790           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01791                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to lookup for %s, id=%d", 
01792                              data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01793           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: fsal_status = ( %d, %d )", 
01794                              fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
01795           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01796           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01797         }
01798 
01799       if( data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
01800         {
01801           if( ( error =  nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->mounted_on_FH) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
01802             {
01803               DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01804                                  NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to allocate the 'mounted on' file handle" ) ;
01805               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01806               return res_READDIR4.status ;
01807             }
01808         }
01809       
01810       if( data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
01811         {
01812           if( ( error =  nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->currentFH) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
01813             {
01814               DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01815                                  NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to allocate the first file handle" ) ;
01816               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01817               return res_READDIR4.status ;
01818             }
01819         }
01820 
01821       /* Build the nfs4 handle */
01822       if( !nfs4_FSALToFhandle( &data->currentFH, &fsal_handle, data ) )
01823         {
01824           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01825                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to build the first file handle" ) ;
01826           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01827           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01828         }
01829   
01830       /* The new fh is to be the "mounted on Filehandle" */
01831       memcpy( data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_val, data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val, sizeof( file_handle_v4_t ) ) ;
01832       data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len = data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ;
01833       
01834       /* Add the entry to the cache as a root (BUGAZOMEU: make it a junction entry when junction is available) */
01835       fsdata.handle = fsal_handle ;
01836       fsdata.cookie = 0 ;
01837       if( ( pentry = cache_inode_make_root( &fsdata, 
01838                                             data->ht, 
01839                                             ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient), 
01840                                             data->pcontext,
01841                                             &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
01842         {
01843           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, 
01844                            "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Allocate root entry in cache inode failed, for %s, id=%d", 
01845                            data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01846           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01847           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01848         }
01849 
01850       
01851       /* Get the attributes (costless: the attributes was cached when the root pentry was created */
01852       if(  cache_inode_getattr( pentry, 
01853                                 &attr, 
01854                                 data->ht,
01855                                 ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient), 
01856                                 data->pcontext,
01857                                 &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01858         {
01859           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01860                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to get attributes for root pentry" );
01861           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01862           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01863         }
01864 
01865       /* Keep the pentry within the compound data */
01866       data->current_entry = pentry ;
01867       data->current_filetype = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( attr.type ) ;
01868 
01869 
01870       /* redo the call on the other side of the junction */
01871       return nfs4_op_readdir( op, data, resp ) ;
01872     }
01873 
01874   /* Allocation of the entries array */
01875   if( ( entry_nfs_array = (entry4 *)Mem_Alloc( estimated_num_entries * sizeof( entry4 ) ) ) == NULL )
01876     {
01877       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, errno ) ;
01878       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01879       return res_READDIR4.status;
01880     }
01881 
01882   /* Cookie verifier has the value of the Server Boot Time for pseudo fs */
01883 #ifdef _WITH_COOKIE_VERIFIER
01884   /* BUGAZOMEU: management of the cookie verifier */
01885   memset(cookie_verifier, 0, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
01886   if( NFS_SpecificConfig.UseCookieVerf == 1 )
01887     {
01888       memcpy(cookie_verifier, &ServerBootTime, sizeof( ServerBootTime) );
01889       if( cookie !=0  )
01890         {
01891           if(  memcmp(cookie_verifier, arg_READDIR4.cookieverf, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE  ) != 0 )
01892             {
01893               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_COOKIE ;
01894               Mem_Free( entry_nfs_array ) ;
01895               return  res_READDIR4.status ;
01896             }    
01897         }
01898     }
01899 #endif
01900   /* Cookie delivered by the server and used by the client SHOULD not ne 0, 1 or 2 (cf RFC3530, page192)
01901    * because theses value are reserved for special use.
01902    *      0 - cookie for first READDIR
01903    *      1 - reserved for . on client handside
01904    *      2 - reserved for .. on client handside
01905    * Entries '.' and '..' are not returned also
01906    * For these reason, there will be an offset of 3 between NFS4 cookie and HPSS cookie */
01907   
01908   /* make sure to start at the right position given by the cookie */
01909   iter = psfsentry.sons ;
01910   if( cookie != 0 )
01911     {
01912       for( ; iter != NULL ; iter = iter->next )
01913         if( ( iter->pseudo_id + 3 ) == cookie )
01914           break ;
01915     }
01916   
01917   /* Here, where are sure that iter is set to the position indicated eventually by the cookie */
01918   i = 0 ;
01919   for( ; iter != NULL ; iter = iter->next )
01920     {
01921       DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "PSEUDO FS: Found entry %s", iter->name ) ;
01922       
01923       entry_nfs_array[i].name.utf8string_len = strlen( iter->name ) ;
01924       entry_nfs_array[i].name.utf8string_val = iter->name ;
01925       entry_nfs_array[i].cookie = iter->pseudo_id + 3 ;
01926 
01927       /* If file handle is asked in the attributes, provide it */
01928       if( arg_READDIR4.attr_request.bitmap4_val[0] & FATTR4_FILEHANDLE )
01929         {
01930           if( entryFH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
01931             {
01932               if( nfs4_AllocateFH( &entryFH ) != NFS4_OK )
01933                 {
01934                   return res_READDIR4.status ;
01935                 }
01936             }
01937           
01938           if( !nfs4_PseudoToFhandle( &entryFH, iter ) )
01939             {
01940               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01941               Mem_Free( entry_nfs_array ) ;
01942               return res_READDIR4.status ;
01943             }
01944         }
01945 
01946       if( nfs4_PseudoToFattr( iter,
01947                               &(entry_nfs_array[i].attrs), 
01948                               data, 
01949                               &entryFH,
01950                               &(arg_READDIR4.attr_request) ) != 0 )
01951         {
01952           /* Should never occured, but the is no reason for leaving the section without any information */
01953           entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attrmask  = RdAttrErrorBitmap ;
01954           entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attr_vals = RdAttrErrorVals ;
01955         }
01956   
01957       /* Chain the entry together */
01958       entry_nfs_array[i].nextentry = NULL;
01959       if( i != 0 )
01960         entry_nfs_array[i-1].nextentry = &(entry_nfs_array[i]);
01961     
01962       /* Increment the counter */
01963       i += 1 ;
01964       
01965       /* Did we reach the maximum number of entries */
01966       if( i == estimated_num_entries )
01967         break ;
01968     }
01969 
01970   /* Resize entry_nfs_array */
01971   /* @todo : Is this reallocation actually needed ? */
01972 #ifdef BUGAZOMEU
01973   if( i < estimated_num_entries )
01974     if( ( entry_nfs_array = Mem_Realloc( entry_nfs_array, i * sizeof( entry4 ) ) ) == NULL )
01975       {
01976       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, errno ) ;
01977       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01978       Mem_Free( entry_nfs_array ) ;
01979       return res_READDIR4.status;
01980     }
01981 #endif
01982   /* Build the reply */
01983   memcpy( res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.cookieverf, cookie_verifier, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
01984   if( i == 0 )
01985     res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries = NULL ;
01986   else
01987     res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries = entry_nfs_array ;
01988 
01989   /* did we reach the end ? */
01990   if( iter == NULL )
01991     {
01992       /* Yes, we did */
01993       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.eof = TRUE ;
01994     }
01995   else
01996     {
01997       /* No, there are some more entries */
01998       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.eof = FALSE ;
01999     }
02000   
02001   /* Exit properly */
02002   res_READDIR4.status = NFS4_OK ; 
02003   
02004   return NFS4_OK ;
02005 } /* nfs4_op_readdir_pseudo */
Generated on Wed Apr 9 08:24:29 2008 for NFS and Mount protocols layer by  1.3.9.1
